title: The New Jerusalem
verses:
O tell me no more
Of this world's vain store,
The time for such trifles
With me now is o'er.

A city I've found
Where true joys abound;
To dwell I'm determined
On this happy ground.

My soul, don't delay,
He calls thee away;
Rise, follow thy Savior,
And bless the glad day.

metadata.theological_significance: Call to abandon worldly pursuits for the heavenly city
